x10.constraint.xnative
Class XNativeConstraint

java.lang.Object
  x10.constraint.xnative.XNativeConstraint
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, XConstraint
public class XNativeConstraint
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, XConstraint

A constraint solver for the following constraint system. Note terms in this constraint system are untyped. 

 t ::= x                  -- variable
       | t.f              -- field access
       | g(t1,..., tn)    -- uninterpreted function symbol
       
 c ::= t == t             -- equality
       | t != t           -- dis-equality
       | c,c              -- conjunction
       | p(t1,..., tn)    -- atomic formula
The constraint system implements the usual congruence rules for equality. That is, if s1,...,sn and t1,...,tn are terms, and s1 == t1,..., sn == tn, then g(s1,..., sn) == g(s1,...,sn), and p(t1,..., tn) == p(t1,...,tn). Further,
  • s equals t implies t equals s
  • s equals t and t equals u implies s equals u
  • it is always the case that s equals s

    Terms are created using the static API in XNativeTerms. The == relation on terms at the level of the constraint system is translated into the equals relation on the Java representation of the terms.

    A constraint is implemented as a graph whose nodes are XPromises. Two different constraints will not share @link{XPromise}. See the description of

    vj

    leastUpperBound

    public XConstraint leastUpperBound(XConstraint other)
    Description copied from interface: XConstraint
    Return the least upper bound of this and other. That is, the resulting constraint has precisely the constraints entailed by both this and other. (Note: An inconsistent constraint entails every constraint, and a valid constraint entails only those constraints such as x=x that every constraint entails.)

    Specified by:
    leastUpperBound in interface XConstraint
    Returns:

    residue

    public XConstraint residue(XConstraint other)
    Description copied from interface: XConstraint
    Return those subset of constraints in the base set of other that are not implied by this. That is, return the residue r such that (r and this) implies other.

    Specified by:
    residue in interface XConstraint
    Parameters:
    other - -- must be checked for consistency before call is made
    Returns:

    substitute

    public XNativeConstraint substitute(XNativeTerm y,
                                    XNativeVar x)
                             throws XFailure
    If y equals x, or x does not occur in this, return this, else copy the constraint and return it after performing applySubstitution(y,x).

    substitute
